metrics.baseline: Paper that describes the base model

goals.description: Increased number of visits to the garden

system.task: Identify flowers in pictures taken at the garden
system.usage_context: The model will be part of an application that runs on a device loaned out by a botanical garden so that visitors can identify flowers during their visit.
risks: Poor user experience due to incorrectly identified flowers
Poor user experience due to inability to identify flowers
Wrong results due to unknown flowers
Users do not like the results due to strange behavior.

fields.name: Phylum
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below kingdom and above Clade 1.

fields.name: Clade1
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Phylum and above Clade 2.

fields.name: Clade2
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Clade 1 and above Clade 3.

fields.name: Clade3
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Clade 2 and above Order.

fields.name: Order
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Clade 3 and above Family.

fields.name: Family
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Order and above Subfamily.

fields.name: Subfamily
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Family and above Genus.

fields.name: Genus

model.deployment_platform: Model will be deployed on a small device loaned out to garden visitors.
model.capability_deployment_mechanism: The model will expose an API that will be called from the flower identification application.

input_specification.name: flower-picture
input_specification.description: Path to the picture of the flower taken at the garden
input_specification.expected_values: String corresponding to a valid path to a picture in PNG format

output_specification.name: flower-number-for-lookup
output_specification.description: Number of the flower identified in the picture, which is used as a lookup number for a table that contains the identified flower information. This table is derived from the training data.
output_specification.expected_values: Either flower number between 0 and 102, or -1 to indicate that it could not identify the flower.

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: Regardless of the location in the garden, the model can correctly identify the correct flowers

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden, and it is a bit blurry,
system_requirements.measure: at the same rate as non-blurry images

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.source: the flower identification application running on a loaned device
system_requirements.environment: normal operations. These devices are known to sometimes lose a channel (i.e., RGB channel)
system_requirements.measure: at the same rate as full images

system_requirements.stimulus: The model running on the loaned device receives pictures taken at the garden
system_requirements.environment: normal operations. The loaned devices are small, inexpensive devices with limited CPU power, as well as limited memory and disk space (512 MB and 150 MB, respectively)
system_requirements.response: The model executes on the loaned device
system_requirements.measure: without any errors due to unavailable resources

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: The application indicates main features that were used to recognize the flower, as part of the educational experience.
system_requirements.measure: The app displays the original image highlighting the most informative features in flower identification, in addition to the flower name

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: The model identifies the flower correctly

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: Model correctly processes inputs and produces outputs
system_requirements.measure: according to established input and output specifications without exceptions

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML pipeline receives a picture taken at the garden that does not conform to the input specification
system_requirements.response: The model does not process the input
system_requirements.measure: and instead the ML pipeline produces -99 as the output and creates a log entry with the tag "Model - Input Validation Error - <Input>, where <Input> is the original input.

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML pipeline receives a picture that corresponds to an OOD input
system_requirements.response: The model will process the input
system_requirements.measure: and the ML pipeline will create a log entry with the tag "Model - Input OOD Error - <Input>, where <Input> is the original input

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML pipeline detects an output distribution change
system_requirements.source: the output produced by the model
system_requirements.response: The ML pipeline will create a log entry
system_requirements.measure: with the tag "Model - Output Confidence Error - <Output>, where <Output> is the output produced by the model that triggered the condition

system_requirements.stimulus: Model running on the loaned device receives a picture
system_requirements.response: The time for the model to return an output
